intro: Androsace carnea var. halleri, commonly known as the pink rock rose, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features hairy, ovate leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in the spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
